meanings.definition: To come together to form one mass or whole.
meanings.sent1: The ingredients slowly coalesce into a thick soup.
meanings.sent2: The clouds coalesce in the sky before a storm.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces coalesce perfectly, revealing the hidden picture.
meanings.sent4: The diverse voices in the choir coalesce into a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: As the music played, the crowd's energy coalesced into a shared excitement.

meanings.definition: To unite or merge into a single body or group.
meanings.sent1: The two companies decided to coalesce and become a stronger entity.
meanings.sent2: Different colors coalesce to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The flavors of the dish coalesce in a burst of deliciousness.
meanings.sent4: The ideas from various sources coalesce into a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The dancers' movements coalesce into a mesmerizing performance.
